poem:
Title: Of Worry

In the early morn, the lantern 
of worry is lit, the soul stirs.
What is that hushed whisper in the mouth
of the child, the screen a siren in its clutch?
What of the speck of dust, or the tear of the year 
yet unwrapped? These thousand burdens we bear,
unseen, sculpting parenthood's prayer.
